DIV1.P: The table below gives a brief description of all templates included in the Text Class distribution. As a companion, you may also want to view the list of processing instructions also supported in text class.

TR.TD: Displays a form for emailing the contents of the book bag. The form contains only one input box for an email address.
Displays current contents of the book bag.
Form for citation searching in individual collections.
Extended form for citation searching across multiple collections.
Form for boolean searching in individual collections.
Form for boolean searching within contents of book bag.
Extended form for boolean searching across multiple collections.
Displays bibliographic header and table of contents or search results.
Home page template for links to home after sessions have been established.
Displays contents of a note within a designated target window.
Draws the frameset for displaying documents as page-facsimile-images.
Main frame of pageviewer.frameset containing the current page image.
Top frame of pageviewer.frameset containing all document and site navigation.

For incidences where an id reference to a document may be incomplete, producing a list of documents with ids that contain the id reference. The template generates a list of possible documents as a linked list.
Form for proximity searching in an individual collection.
Form for proximity searching within book bag contents.
Extended form for proximity searching across multiple collections.
Displays results for searches against one or more collections.
Displays a search history for the current session as a table, containing, in one table, the successfully submitted queries as links for resubmission.
Form for simple searches against individual collections.
Form for simple searches within book bag contents.
Extended form for simple searches across multiple collections.
Displays a linked list of all available collections (in a multiple collection context), allowing users to go to home pages for each collection.
Similar to pageviewer.picklist.tpl, but for documents that are fully encoded text.
Displays any requested portion of a fully encoded text.
Displays a warning note when the "view entire text" link is selected from a bibliographic header page.
Word wheel index form after a word index has been started. Produces a picklist containing a range of words from the word index.
Word index initial form. Displays an input box or linked index for entering a word index.
